column1: L, GOPer Whines 'They're Going To Expand Health Care And Education', David, 2021-07-04, We need your help now more than ever. Please subscribe or donate to us on a recurring or one-time basis.
column2: Rep. Michael McCaul (R-TX) on Sunday said that he opposed a House infrastructure bill because Democrats want to "muck it up" with spending on health care and education.
column3: I think infrastructure is popular McCaul told Fox News host Mike Emanuel. "I think it is bipartisan. I know the Senate working with the president is trying to work out a bipartisan agreement. That's our best chance for success here."
column4: I think what the House [Speaker Nancy Pelosi] put forward was a totally partisan measure he continued. "One out of every two dollars went to the Green New Deal. Totally unacceptable to Republicans."
column5: McCaul argued that Democrats should be focused on what he called "traditional infrastructure" like roads and bridges.
column6: He opposed the Democratic bill because he said his opponents were going to "muck it up" with other types of infrastructure.
column7: Things that have nothing to do with infrastructure McCaul complained. "I worry that they're going to expand health care and education that have nothing to do with infrastructure."
